Victor Chng, Co-Founder at Fifth Person Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 18 Feb 2019Hi, You can invest in stocks, unit trust or gold using your CPF. My take is CPF is hard earned money and the SA account can give at least 4% interest. If other investments can;t give you more than 4% return a year then It is better off putting your money inside the SA account. 0 comments0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 15 Feb 2019You can purchase stocks, gold, Unit Trusts, ILPs. My recommendation would be to invest in a globally diversified portfolio with asset allocation according to your age and investment horizon using funds.You can speak to an FA like myself to set one up. It's cheaper now to invest using CPF then ever before and it's still quite possible to achieve a projected 6-8% returns per annum over a 10-20 year horizon from the approved fund list provided by CPF themselves. I've selected 6 of them to create such a global portfolio for my clients.The best part about investing your CPF is that, if at any time, there is a worry for an impending recession, you can always exit your positions and go back to earning a 2.5% interest on your OA.0 comments0
